scrape.title: The dinner
scrape.author: Natalie Thomas
scrape.text: **this post contains spoilers**I loved that "The Dinner" touched upon so many different issues: privilege, capital punishment, vigilantism, politics, family dynamics and discord, cultural differences and social etiquette. I thought the story progressed at the perfect pace. No points felt belabored and I never felt that Mr. Koch was using this novel as his own personal soapbox. There were points during the meal that I felt as tense as the characters, as annoyed by the waiter and manager, as scared as the children and as angry as Paul.I enjoyed this book a lot but I had a few issues. Could be because I'm a nosy person. These three things left me unfulfilled:1) not knowing what Claire's hospitalization was caused by2) not knowing what mental illness afflicted Paul3) not knowing what happened to Beau
